Exaggerate: The claim of human sacrifice at Padma Bridge in Bangladesh is exaggerated, as there is no evidence or factual basis to support such a claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no credible evidence or reliable sources to back up the assertion of human sacrifice at Padma Bridge.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the doctored image and accompanying text are true, without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the claim is a rumor or misinformation, as stated by the director of the Padma Bridge project and supported by the Ministry of Road Transport and Bridges in Bangladesh.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no truth to the allegations of human sacrifice at Padma Bridge, as confirmed by the authorities and experts involved in the project.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no indication that the claim falters at times or is inconsistent in its presentation of information.
Other biases: There may be additional biases present in the claim, but they are not evident from the information provided.
